Interface DataManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataManager

    public interface DataManagerInterface

    Title: DataManagerInterface

    Description: Gives the method headers for the DataManager that are used in the DataManagerTest

    Your DataManager which implements this DataManagerInterface may contain additional

    not listed here

    Your DataManager will be a composition of an OrderManager and a CustomerManager

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Professor Myers

      void reset()
      This resets the static OrderNumber in the OrderManager back to 1001 and the static CustomerNumber in the CustomerManager back to 101

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        void reset()
        This resets the static OrderNumber in the OrderManager back to 1001 and the static CustomerNumber in the CustomerManager back to 101

      • addOrder

        boolean addOrder(int customerNum,
               double purchase)
        Retrieves the customer object using the get method from the CustomerManager object Adds an order to the OrderManager through its addOrder method Updates the purchases for the Customer (addPurchases method)
        Parameters:
        customerNum - the Customer Number
        purchase - the amount of the purchase
        Returns:
        true if the order was added successfully, false if the customer number was invalid and therefore order not added

      • getDetailsOfLastOrder

        java.lang.String getDetailsOfLastOrder()
        Print out details of last order in the following format: (Uses toString method of Order)

        Order #: (order number)

        Customer #: (customer number)(2 spaces)(last name, first name)

        Purchase amount: (purchase amount in currency format)

        Discount: (discount percent in percent format)(2 spaces)(discount amount in currency format)

        Tax: (tax percent in percent format)(2 spaces)(tax amount in currency format)

        Final cost: (final cost in current format)

        Examples:

        Order #: 1001

        Customer #: 103 Hawthorne, Gale

        Purchase amount: $54.77

        Discount: 0% $0.00

        Tax: 6% $3.29

        Final cost $58.06

        Order #: 1002

        Customer #: 105 Snow, Coriolanus

        Purchase amount: $369.33

        Discount: 10% $36.93

        Tax: 6% $19.94

        Final cost $352.34

      • getCustomerNumber

        int getCustomerNumber(java.lang.String firstName,
                    java.lang.String lastName)
        Returns the customer number for the following customer if this customer exists
        Parameters:
        firstName - first name of customer
        lastName - lastname of customer
        Returns:
        a customer number if the customer exits, -1 if the customer doesn't exist

      • addCustomer

        int addCustomer(java.lang.String custFName,
              java.lang.String custLName,
              java.lang.String custAddress,
              double purchase)
        Add customer to ArrayList of customer objects in the CustomerManager through the addCustomer method in the CustomerManager object
        Parameters:
        custFName - Customer first name
        custLName - Customer last name
        custAddress - Customer address
        purchase - Customer purchase amount
        Returns:
        customerNumber if added customer successfully, -1 if not added successfully

      • printCustomers

        java.lang.String printCustomers()
        Print all the customers in order by Customer number in the CustomerManager Uses the printCustomers method in the CustomerManager

        Customers printed in the following format:

        (First name)(space)(Last name)

        Customer Number: (customer number)

        (customer address)

        Purchases: (purchases in currency format)

        Discount: (discount in percent format)

        (1 blank line between customers)

        Example:

        Katniss Everdeen

        Customer Number: 101

        86 Hopeless Dr, The Seam

        Purchases: $23.56

        Discount: 0%

        (1 empty line)

        Effie Trinket

        Customer Number: 106

        654 High Society Blvd, The Capitol

        Purchases: $1,828.52

        Discount: 7%

        Returns:
        a String with all the customers listed in customer number

      • printOrders

        java.lang.String printOrders()
        Prints all the orders in order by Order Number in the OrderManager uses the printOrders in the OrderManager Print out each order in the following format:

        Order #: (order number)

        Customer #: (customer number)(2 spaces)(last name, first name)

        Purchase amount: (purchase amount in currency format)

        Discount: (discount percent in percent format)(2 spaces)(discount amount in currency format)

        Tax: (tax percent in percent format)(2 spaces)(tax amount in currency format)

        Final cost: (final cost in current format)

        (1 blank line separates orders)

        Example:

        Order #: 1001

        Customer #: 103 Hawthorne, Gale

        Purchase amount: $54.77

        Discount: 0% $0.00

        Tax: 6% $3.29

        Final cost $58.06

        (1 blank line between orders)

        Order #: 1002

        Customer #: 105 Snow, Coriolanus

        Purchase amount: $369.33

        Discount: 10% $36.93

        Tax: 6% $19.94

        Final cost $352.34

        Returns:
        a string with all the orders listed in order number
